sentence.Network_en: He would flog her to death with a rubber truncheon.
sentence.Network_cn: 他用橡皮警棍把她活活抽死.

sentence.Network_en: All he had eyes for was the truncheon in the guard's hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看到的只有那个警卫手中的橡皮棍.

sentence.Network_en: While the truncheon may be used in lieu of conversation, words always retain their power.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然警棍的暴虐取代了谈话的公正,语言, 依然有着力量!

list.abs: The police were armed with truncheons and riot shields ., 警察用警棍和防暴盾牌来武装的.
The police were armed with truncheons and riot shields ., 警察用警棍和防暴盾牌来武装的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a piece broken off (especially from a spear), also a cudgel): from Old French tronchon 'stump', based on Latin truncus 'trunk'

entry.def: A truncheon is a short, thick stick that is carried as a weapon by a policeman.

means.word_mean: 1. a short stout club used primarily by policemen

auth_sentence.content: A huge truncheon of wreck half buried in the sands.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A huge truncheon of wreck half buried in the sands.

auth_sentence.content: The man, still holding his truncheon, folded his arms over his chest.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The man, still holding his truncheon, folded his arms over his chest.

auth_sentence.content: Now, having spent two years at the Home Office, he says he is more likely to use a truncheon than hug a hoodie.

sentences.en: Some of the prisoners were beaten about the head with rubber truncheons.
sentences.cn: 一些囚犯头部遭到橡皮警棍的击打。
